Having thus discussed the various names of the store consciousness, how can we understand its characteristics?
Its characteristics are established in three ways:
First, establishing its own characteristics, second, establishing its causal characteristics, and third, establishing its resultant characteristics.

Here, establishing the characteristics of the Älaya consciousness itself means that it is the cause for the arising of all defiled dharmas through the perfuming of those dharmas, because it is able to hold the seeds in association.

Here, establishing the causal characteristics of the Älaya consciousness means that this Älaya consciousness with all the seeds is at all times the cause for the manifestation of those defiled dharmas.

Here, establishing the resultant characteristics of the Älaya consciousness means that the Älaya consciousness continues to arise through the perfuming of those defiled dharmas since beginningless time.
Next, what is called perfuming?
Perfuming is the name.
What is the referent?
It means that when a dharma arises together with another dharma and ceases together with it, there is the causal nature of being able to give rise to that other dharma. This is the referent.
For example, there is a flower in a sesame seed. The sesame seed and the flower arise and perish together. These sesame seeds are born with the power to produce that fragrance.

Also, it is like the one who is established as a practitioner of greed, etc. The perfuming of greed, etc. is based on the arising and perishing together with that greed, etc. This mind is born with the power to produce that.

Or, for the one who hears much, the perfuming of hearing much is based on the attention given to hearing and arises and perishes together. This mind is born with the power to produce that memory. Because of this perfuming, it is able to grasp and hold, and is called the one who upholds the Dharma.
The principle of perfuming in the Älaya consciousness should be understood in the same way.

Having thus established the categories and characteristics of the store consciousness, how do we know that these categories and characteristics definitely belong to the store consciousness and not to the evolving consciousnesses?
Because if we abandon the establishment of the store consciousness, then both defilement and purification are impossible.

How is the defilement of passion impossible?
Because it is unreasonable for the substance of the seeds perfumed by the propensities of the passions and secondary passions to exist in the group of the six consciousnesses.
Why is this?

If this eye consciousness has already ceased and is interrupted by other consciousnesses, then the perfuming and the basis of perfuming cannot be obtained. Moreover, the perfuming that arises together with craving, etc., of this eye consciousness is also not accomplished:

It also cannot be said to abide in the other consciousnesses, because the support of those consciousnesses is different and there is no certainty of arising and ceasing together.
It also cannot be said to abide in its own substance, because that substance definitely has no arising and ceasing together.
Therefore, it is unreasonable that the eye consciousness is perfumed by the passions and secondary passions.

Moreover, when one descends from the heavens of no thought and the other upper stages and is reborn here, at that moment the first consciousness that is defiled by the passions and secondary passions would be without a seed, because the support and its perfuming have already passed away and do not now exist.

Because the nature of this consciousness as an antidote is liberation, and it does not occur simultaneously with the other passions and secondary passions or perish simultaneously with them.

Later, when the consciousness of the world arises, at that time, if it were apart from the Älaya consciousness, those perfuming and their support would have long since passed away and would not exist, and therefore there would be no seeds from which they could be born.

How is mundane purity impossible?

That is, one who has not yet eliminated the craving of the realm of desire and has not yet attained the mind of the realm of form, by means of a good mind of the realm of desire, strives to cultivate the practice in order to eliminate the craving of the realm of desire.

This mind of the realm of desire that is the practice does not arise and perish together with the mind of the realm of form, and therefore it is not perfumed by it. It is not reasonable that it be the seed of that mind.
Also, the mind of the realm of form that is past is separated by many other minds and should not be the seed of the present concentrated mind, because it is nonexistent.
Therefore, the mind of concentration of the realm of form, which is the result of retribution that possesses all the seeds, is transmitted successively and becomes the cause of the present mind.
The mind of good practice is the dominant condition.
In this way, in all stages of detachment from the realm of desire, you should understand as is fitting.
In this way, mundane purity is impossible if you exclude the consciousness that is retribution that possesses all the seeds.
How is supramundane purity impossible?
The World-Honored One has said that the arising of right view is due to the causes of the words of others and the internal proper attention of each individual.
Do these words of others and proper attention perfume the ear consciousness?
Or do they perfume the mental consciousness?
Or do they perfume both?
If one properly contemplates those dharmas, at that time the ear consciousness cannot arise.

If it arises in association with proper attention, then that mental consciousness perfumed by hearing has long since ceased and definitely does not exist. How can it again be the seed able to give rise to a mind associated with proper attention at a later time?

Moreover, the mind associated with proper attention is a worldly mind, while that associated with right view is a supramundane mind. There has never been a time when they arise and cease together. Therefore this mind is not perfumed by that.
Since it is not perfumed, it is unreasonable that it be the seed of that.
Therefore, if the supramundane pure mind is separated from the consciousness that is retribution and contains all seeds, it cannot be established.
Because the perfuming of hearing is included in the seeds of that consciousness, and is not associated with it.
Next, how can the consciousness that is retribution and contains all seeds be the cause of defilement and also be the seed of the supramundane pure mind that can counteract it?
Moreover, since the supramundane mind has never been cultivated before, its perfuming must definitely be nonexistent. If there is no perfuming, from what seeds does it arise?
Therefore, you should answer:
It arises from the seeds of the perfuming of hearing the true Dharma, which flows from the most pure realm of reality.
Is this perfuming of hearing the nature of the Älaya consciousness?
Or is it not the nature of the Älaya consciousness?
If it is the nature of the Älaya consciousness, how can it be the seed of its antidote?
If it is not the nature of the Älaya consciousness, what can be seen as the support of the seeds of the perfuming of hearing?

Until the attainment of the enlightenment of all Buddhas, this perfuming of hearing, in whatever place it is transferred to and resides, is lodged in the consciousness as retribution and evolves together with it in a combined way, like water and milk.
However, it is not the Älaya consciousness, because it is the seed of the antidote to that consciousness.

Here, the inferior perfuming becomes medium perfuming, and the medium perfuming becomes superior perfuming, because of the association with hearing, reflection, and contemplation, and because of the cultivation of much practice.

Also, you should know that the seeds of the perfuming of hearing, whether inferior, medium, or superior, are also seeds of the Dharma Body, because they are opposed to the Älaya consciousness, they are not categorized as Älaya consciousness, and they are the nature of the outflow of the pure realm of the Dharma that is supramundane. Even though they are mundane, they are the seeds of supramundane mind.

Moreover, even before the supramundane mind has arisen, it is already able to counteract the entanglements of the afflictions, it is already able to counteract the difficult and evil destinies, it is already able to cause the decay and counteract all evil karma that has been done, and it is also able to follow and serve all Buddhas and Bodhisattvas.

Once the basis of all kinds has been transformed, then the consciousness of retribution and all seeds are transformed without seeds, and all kinds are eternally severed.
Next, how is it like water and milk?
How can the non-Älaya consciousness and the Älaya consciousness increase and decrease in the same place and at the same time?
It is like a swan drinking milk from water.

Also, it is like the case in the world where when one attains freedom from desire, the perfuming of the stage of non-concentration gradually decreases, and the perfuming of the stage of concentration gradually increases, and thus one attains the transmutation of the support.
Also, when one enters the concentration of cessation, consciousness is not separated from the body, as the sages have said.
Here, the consciousness as retribution would not be separated from the body, and it is not born in order to counteract this concentration of cessation.

Because it would not be concentration, because the object and mode of activity cannot be apprehended, because there would be the fault of association with the roots of goodness, because it is unreasonable that it be non-good or indeterminate, because there would be the fault of the actual dharmas of ideation and feeling, because contact can be apprehended, because it has the power of concentration, because there would be the fault of the mere cessation of ideation, and because there would be the fault of the actual dharmas of volition, faith, etc., because it is unreasonable that the support be separated from the supported by uprooting it, because there is an analogy, and because, if it were not a universal, it would not exist as it does.

Here there are three verses:

How can you claim that the transformation of the support is without remainder?
If the transformation of the support is an antidote and not an elimination, then it is not established.
If there is no difference between cause and effect, then there is the error that the effect is already present in the cause.
If you claim that the transformation of the support is the absence of seeds or the absence of a real substance,
then because the absence of the two is also absent, the transformation of the support is not reasonable.
Next, what are the distinctions of this store consciousness?
In brief, it should be understood as being of three kinds or four kinds.
The three kinds are due to the distinctions of the three kinds of perfuming.

The first is the difference in perfuming by names and expressions, the second is the difference in perfuming by the view of a self, and the third is the difference in perfuming by the members of existence.
The four kinds are: first, the difference in evoking; second, the difference in retribution; third, the difference in the characteristics of conditions; and fourth, the difference in characteristics.
Among them, the difference in evoking refers to the newly arising perfuming.
If this did not exist, the condition of action as the cause of consciousness and the condition of grasping as the cause of existence would not be possible.
Among them, the difference in retribution refers to the difference in retribution in the various destinies caused by the conditions of action and existence.
If this did not exist, then without seeds, the arising of the dharmas of subsequent existence would not be possible.
Among them, the difference in the characteristics of conditions refers to the characteristics of conditions for the grasping of self in the mind.
If this did not exist, then the object of grasping of self in the defiled mind would not be possible.
Among them, the difference in characteristics refers to:

That is to say, this consciousness has common characteristics and uncommon characteristics, has the characteristic of seeds that do not produce results, and has the characteristic of seeds that produce results, and so on.
The common characteristics are the seeds of the world receptacle.
The uncommon characteristics are the seeds of the various internal organs.
The common characteristics are seeds that do not produce results, and the uncommon characteristics are seeds that produce results.
When the antidote arises, only the uncommon characteristics are eliminated.

The common characteristics are held by the imaginations of others and are only seen as pure, just as the yogin, with regard to one thing, has various intentions and various things that are seen, and all are established.
Here there are two verses:
It should be known that the common bonds are difficult to eliminate and difficult to understand completely,
Because the mind of the yogin is different, due to the largeness of external characteristics.
Even though the pure one does not eliminate them, he sees purity in them;
And the pure Buddha land is seen as pure by the Buddha.
There is also another verse:
In response to the various understandings and various views mentioned above, all are established.
The yogis, with regard to one thing, have various understandings, each different,
And the various views they see are all established. Therefore, one should know that the perceived objects are only consciousness.
If this were not so, the distinctions in the arising of the world of vessels and the world of sentient beings would not be possible.
There are also characteristics of coarseness and heaviness, and characteristics of lightness and ease:
The characteristic of coarseness and heaviness refers to the seeds of afflictions and secondary afflictions.
The characteristic of lightness and ease refers to the seeds of contaminated wholesome dharmas.
If this were not so, the matured retribution would lack the capacity for anything, and the distinctions in the basis of having the capacity for something would not be possible.
There are also characteristics of having exhaustion and characteristics of not having exhaustion:
The characteristic of having exhaustion refers to the seeds of wholesome and unwholesome dharmas that have already matured into retribution.

The characteristic of non-exhaustion refers to the seeds perfumed by names and expressions, because they are the seeds of the various false discriminations that have been circulating since beginningless time.
If this were not so, then the exhaustion of the results of good and evil actions already done would not be possible.
Also, the arising of new perfuming by names and expressions would not be possible.
There is also a characteristic of analogy:
That is, this Älaya consciousness is an analogy for an illusion, a mirage, a dream, and a visual distortion.
If this were not so, then the characteristic of the inverted conditions would not be possible because of the seeds of unreal imagination.
